name: #If you do not like these changes below, you may delete/comment the appropriate entry below here, then delete the script. If the entry does not exist, delete the script only. The hullmod behavior default to the original instead.
ECM Package
desc: When deployed in combat, grants %s/%s/%s/%s ECM rating, depending on this ship's hull size.
short: Increases ship's ECM rating.

name: Nav Relay
desc:
When deployed in combat, increases nav rating of your fleet by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on this ship's hull size.

The total nav rating of your fleet increases the top speed of your deployed ships.
short: Increases top speed of deployed ships.

name: Operations Center
desc: Increases the command point recovery rate by %s when installed on the flagship.
short: Increases command point recovery rate when on flagship.

name: Ballistic Rangefinder
desc: <tooltip created in the script due to lots of highlighting>
short: Increases base range of small and medium weapons in ballisic slots.

name: High Scatter Amplifier
desc: <tooltip created in the script due to sections>
short: Reduces beam range; beams deal more damage and apply hard flux to shields.

name: Expanded Deck Crew
desc:
Reduces the rate at which the fighter replacement rate decreases due to fighter losses by %s, and increases the rate at which it recovers by %s.

Increases the crew required by %s per fighter bay.
short: Improves fighter replacement rate, increases crew requirements.

name: Recovery Shuttles
desc: Reduces the casualties suffered by fighter pilots by %s.
short: Reduces fighter pilot casualties.

name: Efficiency Overhaul
desc:
Reduces supply use for maintenance, fuel use, and minimum crew required by %s.

Increases the combat readiness recovery and repair rates by %s. The per-day supply consumption for CR recovery is increased to account for the increased recovery rate, but the total supply cost remains the same.
short: Reduces ongoing costs and enables more deployments.

name: Militarized Subsystems
desc:
Removes the penalties from a civilian-grade hull, and increases maximum burn level by %s.

Increases flux dissipation by %s, and adds %s armor for the damage reduction calculation only.

Increases minimum crew required by %s.

Will try to engage enemies and otherwise act as a combat ship in battle.
short: Removes sensor penalties, increases maximum burn level, improves combat performance, increases crew required.

name: Adaptive Phase Coils
desc:
Phase coils are less able to maintain a connection with normal space as the ship's hard flux levels rise, resulting in a greadly reduced top speed as the coils struggle to gain traction.

This modification allows the coils to handle higher levels of hard flux, increasing the threshold at which speed bottoms out by %s. For standard-design coils with no other modifications, this takes the threshold from %s to %s.
short: Reduces impact of hard flux level on top speed while phased.

name: Shield Shunt
desc: Removes the ship's shields. The external emitter nodes are replaced with reinforced plating, increasing the ship's armor by %s.
short: Removes shields, increases armor.

name: High Resolution Sensors
desc: Increases sensor strength by %s points for frigates, destroyers, and cruisers, and by %s for capital ships.
short: Increases fleet's sensor range.

name: Converted Hangar
desc: <tooltip created in the script due to lots of highlighting>
short: Improvised fighter bay for non-carriers.

name: Faulty Automated Systems
desc:
Increases minimum crew required by %s and decreases maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Increases minimum crew required, decreases maximum combat readiness.

name: Rugged Construction
desc:
Reduces most negative effects of d-mods by %s. If disabled or destroyed in combat, the ship has a %s chance to avoid new d-mods, and is almost always recoverable after the battle.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
short: Reduces impact of d-mods; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

name: #Replacing only so the player does not get them from salvage because they can't use it unless they have the skill
Neural Interface
desc:
Links the flagship with another ship, allowing switching between ships without using a shuttle pod. Both ships must have a Neural Interface and not be commanded by an officer or an AI core. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less.

If the linked ship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, the flagship will establish a neural link with another ship with a Neural Interface. If the flagship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, command will have to be physically transferred to another ship with a Neural Interface before a new link can be established.

Both linked ships benefit from your personal combat skills as if you'd transferred command to them, regardless of which one you're controlling personally. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or other fixed ship stats - do not apply.
short: Allows rapid switching between ships, resets system cooldown and adds a charge.

name: Neural Integrator
desc:
An augmented version of Neural Interface that works with automated ships by enabling direct control of all of the ship's systems via the link, instead of having the controlling conscousness aspect simply direct the bridge crew.

Links the flagship with another ship, allowing switching between ships without using a shuttle pod. Both ships must have a Neural Interface and not be commanded by an officer or an AI core. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less.

If the linked ship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, the flagship will establish a neural link with another ship with a Neural Interface. If the flagship is destroyed or leaves the battlefield, command will have to be physically transferred to another ship with a Neural Interface before a new link can be established.

Both linked ships benefit from your personal combat skills as if you'd transferred command to them, regardless of which one you're controlling personally. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or other fixed ship stats - do not apply.
short: Specialized Neural Interface for automated ships.

name: Additional Berthing
desc:
Increases maximum crew capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases crew capacity.

name: Auxiliary Fuel Tanks
desc:
Increases maximum fuel capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases fuel capacity.

name: Expanded Cargo Holds
desc:
Increases maximum cargo capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
short: Increases cargo capacity.
